#Text=Tecolutla
#Text=Tecolutla
#Text=is in
#Text=Veracruz
#Text=, a state of Mexico .
#Text=Get in
#Text=Tiny Tecolutla is a beach town located 190 km north of the city of Veracruz along the Gulf of Mexico coast of Mexico .
#Text=It is located close by Papantla and Poza Rica , cities placed near interchanges of highways that link to Tampico to the north and Mexico City to the west .
#Text=Tecolutla is easily accessible by car or by buses linking to Papantla or nearby Zamora de Hidalgo .
#Text=The local language is Spanish , and little English is spoken by locals .
#Text=For bus service check out www.ticketbus.com.mx .
#Text=The town can be reached in one day 's drive from Brownsville or Mcallen , Texas .
#Text=Get around
#Text=The town is very walkable with a small downtown core .
#Text=See
#Text=The town square has some picturesque colored buildings and a small park .
#Text=On the far end of the beach locals operate short boat tours of the nearby mangroves , where a few exotic birds can be seen .
#Text=Do

#Text=Do swim in the ocean water , which has a gentler surf than most pacific Mexican beaches , and which is warm enough for swimming almost all of the year , although hotel pools can be chilly in winter months .
#Text=Beach umbrellas can be rented for the day .
#Text=Visit Fernando Manzano , who collects 20,000 sea turtle eggs a year , hatches them , and then releases them .
#Text=Buy
#Text=The main streets are full of knick-knack stores selling cheesy souvenirs , although there are some local crafts and vanilla liquor from nearby Papantla .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Tourist restaurants abound , although it 's mostly fish dinners .
#Text=A local specialty is fish with Veracruzana sauce , a delicious sugary , spicy tomato-based topping .
#Text=Another local favourite is Mojo de Ajo which is a garlic sauce that is very tasty on fish or shrimp
#Text=Drink
#Text=There are a few bars or nightclubs .
#Text=Most tourists tend to drink on the beach , which is well served by people pushing carts with food or drink .
#Text=On weekends there are often street bars .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=Tecolutla can be crowded during Semana Santa ( Easter ) , when it is popular with Mexicans on holiday .
#Text=At other times the small town is fairly quiet , and finding lodging in one of the many small hotels which line the beach is not difficult .
#Text=With the exception of Easter you can just show up and easily find accommodation ranging in price from US$ 18 - US$ 55 a night , and even less expensive for longer term rentals .
#Text=Stay safe
#Text=Leaving possessions unattended on the beach is n't wise , but generally this is a safe place and the locals are friendly .
#Text=Even the hawkers are usually quite laid-back .
#Text=Camping on the beach at night is not recommended .
